greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array read by antidiagonals: A(n,k) is the number of sets of nonempty subsets of a k-element set where each element appears in at most n subsets.
comment: A(n,k) is the number of binary matrices with k columns and any number of nonzero rows with rows in decreasing order and at most n ones in every column.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..209
program: D(p, n, k)={my(v=vector(n)); for(i=1, #p, v[p[i]]++); (vecsum(WeighT(v)) + 1)^k/prod(i=1, #v, i^v[i]*v[i]!)}
T(n, k)={my(m=n*k+1, q=Vec(exp(intformal(O(x^m) - x^n/(1-x)))/(1+x))); if(n==0, 1, (-1)^m*sum(j=0, m, my(s=0); forpart(p=j, s+=(-1)^#p*D(p, n, k), [1, n]); s*q[#q-j])/2)}
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Jan 04 2020
